testimonials.quote: "42 Interactive is a great tech partner for International Towers. Their innovative ideas help us build our digital experience for the whole precinct. They are reliable, trustworthy and put our best interest first."

testimonials.name: Liam Timms
testimonials.title: Fund Manager
testimonials.quote: "We had an amazing experience working with 42 Interactive and fostered a good relationship with the team. They always listened to our business challenges, present when needed and motivated to help. They're good at explaining complicated tech in a way that's easy to understand. What sets them apart is their honesty and helpful feedback on our ideas and tech choices."

testimonials.name: Lily Coleman
testimonials.title: Digital Product Manager
testimonials.quote: "Amazing - I would highly recommend them and I have been very vocal within our business that I have thoroughly enjoyed digital project management alongside them. They are very easy to work with."

testimonials.name: Julie Anders

Their technical expertise and knowledge is exceptional. I highly recommend working with 42 Interactive for not only a professional but a highly enjoyable experience."

podcasts.title: Enhancing User Experience: 42 Interactive's Journey to High Conversion Rates
podcasts.description:
In our recent project, 42 Interactive, in partnership with Innovations Accelerated, tackled the intricate challenges of curbside pickup integration. Initially, our team focused on swift deployment under tight constraints, which led to a crucial realisation about user interaction. It became evident that the final step in the pickup process ‚Äì a simple button click signalling readiness for food preparation ‚Äì was being interpreted in multiple ways by customers. This impacted the efficiency of the service and customer satisfaction.

Responding proactively, we conducted customer testing to understand the gap in the user journey. This step was instrumental in tweaking the system, leading to a significant leap in conversion rates. Our journey with this project showcases our commitment to user-centric design and the importance of continuous feedback in refining digital experiences. We believe in creating solutions that not only meet immediate needs but also evolve with user interactions.

Looking for a partner who values customer interaction in digital design? Let's bring your vision to life.

Visit our website at https://www.42interactive.com/services/digital-design-and-development?utm_source=youtube&utm_medium=social&utm_campaign=digitaldesignanddevelopment


#UserCenteredDesign #DigitalInnovation #CustomerFeedback

podcasts.title: SXSW SYDNEY 2023 - FINAL DAY!
podcasts.description:
It's the final day of SXSW Sydney 2023, and here's Dhani's last-day review:

SXSW Sydney Day 7 Review:

In brief: I suggest that SXSW Sydney should establish its distinct identity, separate from SXSW Austin.

Recommendations:

Implement more focused event tracks.
Consider less crowded sessions.
Prioritize creative showcases over extensive panel discussions.

I hope for immersive experiences, not just prolonged talks on stage. Show me something truly impressive and engaging!

Looking forward to the potential for an even better event next year. What are your thoughts? #sxswsydney

podcasts.title: SXSW QUICK HACKS - DAY 06
podcasts.description:
It's finally the last day of SXSW Sydney 2023! Here are some more helpful tips and tricks from Dhani for #SXSWsydney2023 attendees!

üçî Where to Grab a Bite?
Betty Burger: Offers delicious and budget-friendly options.
Shorty's Food Truck: Serves mouthwatering burgers but comes at a slightly higher price, around $30 for a burger and fries.
Chinatown: Only a quick 10-minute walk away.

üö´ A Friendly Reminder: Please avoid bringing hot food and drinks inside the auditorium. Our dedicated staff and volunteers will kindly ask you to enjoy your refreshments outside, ensuring you don't miss any sessions. This is especially important if your items are uncovered and not securely stored in a bag.
Let's make the most of this final day! #sxswsydney

podcasts.title: SXSW QUICK HACKS - DAY 05
podcasts.description:

Innovation & Tech Expo:
Don't miss out on our expo on ICC Level 4!

Be sure to explore TOMO VR:
Experience an artistic VR dance performance from New Zealand with choreography directed by Gaby Thomas.

podcasts.title: SXSW QUICK HACKS - DAY 04
podcasts.description:
Sharing another tips or hacks from Dhani for #SXSWsydney2023 attendees on Day 4! Here are some helpful parking tips for the attendees, whether it's a working day or the weekend!

Planning to attend weekend sessions and need a parking space? These are the nearest parking options we've personally used, offering reasonable weekend rates around $15-$20, with prices usually higher on normal working days, starting at $25+. Please refer to their respective websites for detailed pricing.

Wilson Parking - Harbourside, Darling Harbour Sydney, NSW Car Park https://lnkd.in/evgPE_rR

First Parking Darling Quarter Car Park | 1/11 Harbour Street https://lnkd.in/ejuPnp7s

ICC Sydney Car Park 1 https://lnkd.in/epFFfASd

First Parking Darling Square Car Park | Zollner Circuit https://lnkd.in/epKwdfvt

If these options are fully booked, and you're up for a bit of a walk and some exercise, consider this one:

Wilson Parking - Barangaroo Reserve https://lnkd.in/eTZ7w96u

However, if you're driving but prefer not to pay for parking:
For Northern dwellers: Park at Artarmon station's north area, where there are plenty of free parking spaces, and catch the train to the city.

For North West or Westies: Park near Hawthorne, Leichhardt North, and Lilyfield lightrail stops. 

Beyond these stops, it's challenging to find parking. These areas offer ample free parking spots, and with the lightrail, you'll reach Darling Harbour in no time.

Eastern burbs: Take advantage of the lightrail ‚Äì you know what to do.

Hope these tips help! See you around! üëã 
#SXSW2023 #ParkingTips #DarlingHarbour

podcasts.title: SXSW QUICK HACKS - DAY 03
podcasts.description:
Here's another valuable tip from Dhani for #SXSWsydney2023 attendees on Day 3!

Make sure to allocate enough time to walk between sessions. Sessions are spread not only at the ICC venue but also at various locations around Darling Harbour, extending as far as the UTS building near Central station. Plan for at least 30 minutes between sessions, so you can manage your schedule accordingly.

Stay tuned for more updates! 
#helpfulhints #SXSWSydney  #lifehacks

podcasts.description:

podcasts.title: Exploring Japan's Innovative Tech: How it Impacts Daily Life and Can Benefit Australia
podcasts.description:
Welcome to the third episode of 42-BTS (Behind The Scene) Podcast series! In the series, we will discuss the impact of Japan's advanced technology on daily life, and compare it to the current technology in Australia. 

We will explore the opportunities and challenges presented by Japan's aging population, and how adopting some of Japan's technology could enhance productivity in Australia. 

Japan is known for its advanced technology integrated into daily life, impacting routines. Unique innovations include smart toilets, vending machines, and high-speed trains. Aging population presents tech challenges but also opportunities. Compared to Australia, Japan has more advanced transportation, robotics, and automation technologies. Adopting some of Japan's tech could improve productivity in Australia.

podcasts.title: A Drug-Free Solution for Your Chronic Pain?
podcasts.description:
Welcome back to our third episode of 42 Tech Friday! :) 

Many people suffer from chronic pain when their injury has healed, but the pain doesn‚Äôt go away. Persistent pain develops and the pain stays for a long time and gets worse and worse.

While physical injury heals within a few months in the process when there was pain, the brain, and the nerves have all learned the pain neuroplastically and they continue to react as if there were pain, so we have to find a way for them to unlearn it.

How can virtual reality technology help manage chronic pain? Please watch this video to dive more into it!

For more information about Neurotechnology & their Innovate Pain Clinic please check out their website here: https://bit.ly/3QjCETr

podcasts.title: Property Scan for White Rabbit Gallery Exhibition HOT BLOOD
podcasts.description:
PROPVIZ Property Scan for White Rabbit Gallery
Exhibition HOT BLOOD

Not for the faint of heart
Since Chinese contemporary art exploded onto the international stage in the 1990s, dramatic changes in Chinese society have, in turn, changed the nature of its art. HOT BLOOD presents a group of artists who confound outmoded expectations about China, reflecting unflinchingly on the most uncomfortable truths of our age.

Explore this extraordinary interactive tour of the HOT BLOOD Exhibition.

HOT BLOOD is drawn completely from Judith Neilson‚Äôs renowned White Rabbit Collection.
CURATOR: David Williams

Exhibition period: 15 March ‚Äì 4 August 2019

*WARNING: Artworks in this exhibition may be disturbing to some visitors and unsuitable for viewing by children.

podcasts.description:
With only nine artists in White Rabbit's The Sleeper Awakes, which takes over four floors of the Chippendale gallery.  But there's certainly no shortage of showstoppers or big ideas on display from these forward-thinking practitioners. A dream where ambition and optimism co-exist with pervasive state control

9 March ‚Äì 29 July 2018
Works from Judith Neilson‚Äôs renowned White Rabbit Collection.

podcasts.title: The White Rabbit Gallery   Exhibition Compilation 2018   2020 3D Virtual Reality
podcasts.description:
The White Rabbit Gallery was opened in 2009 to showcase what has become one of the world‚Äôs most significant collections of Chinese contemporary art. Dedicated to works made in the 21st century, the White Rabbit Collection is owned by Judith Neilson, who was inspired to establish it after her first trips to Beijing in the late 1990s. She was thrilled by the creative energy and technical quality of the works she saw and wanted to share them with people outside China. She makes regular trips to China and Taiwan to augment the Collection, which now includes more than 2000 works by almost 700 artists. The gallery building, a Rolls-Royce service depot in the 1940s, was completely refitted as an exhibition space by architect William Smart. Since the Gallery can house only a fraction of the collection at any one time, there are two new exhibitions a year, each involving a full rehang. For this reason, the Gallery closes during installations, usually in February and August. The White Rabbit Gallery is a registered charitable institution funded solely by Judith Neilson. Admission is free.

podcasts.title: White Rabbit Gallery Virtual Tour  AND NOW
podcasts.description:
AND NOW. The second decade of the White Rabbit Collection‚Äã
AND NOW features works from the second decade of Judith Neilson‚Äôs White Rabbit Collection. Here, nothing is as it seems. A lone figure washes the body of a dead whale, atoning for the destruction wrought by man; rolls of flesh become an omen of relentless progress; diaphanous flags offer the invitation of passage only to deny it moments later; despair is written in salt; glass masquerades as a stone; and, with a touch of futility, silkworms enshroud ancient wood as though to stay the hand of ecological collapse.

Explore this extraordinary interactive tour of the AND NOW Exhibition.

AND NOW is drawn completely from Judith Neilson‚Äôs renowned White Rabbit Collection.
CURATOR: David Williams

Exhibition period: 11 March ‚Äì 2 August 2020.
Visit PROPVIZ website: https://propviz.com.au/
Visit White Rabbit Gallery website: https://www.jnprojects.net/white-rabbit-gallery/virtual-tours/

podcasts.title: Peanut Butter Jelly  3D Room Scanner Video with Hotspots   Scan by PROPVIZ
podcasts.description:
Peanut Butter Jelly is the place where street art meets street food. There are 5 zones inside this venue; each zone comes with an individual theme. 

Our project in PROPVIZ was to provide a 3D room scanner of every corner to showcase the world-class art and the ambience so visitors can feel the unique dining experiences this restaurant has to offer before they are actually there.

podcasts.title: White Rabbit Gallery 3D Virtual Tour   THEN
podcasts.description:
The first ten years of the White Rabbit
THEN celebrates the great adventure of White Rabbit‚Äôs first decade: ten exciting years of showcasing the creative energy, daring, and technical accomplishment of Chinese contemporary art. The gallery‚Äôs tenth-anniversary exhibition presents works by more than 60 artists, all produced during the first ten years of Judith Neilson‚Äôs private collection (2000-2010). THEN tells the story of White Rabbit‚Äôs first, boldly adventurous decade ‚Äì a journey into the unknown that parallels the ambition and audacity of contemporary Chinese art.

Explore this extraordinary interactive tour of the THEN Exhibition.

THEN is drawn completely from Judith Neilson‚Äôs renowned White Rabbit Collection.
CURATOR: David Williams

Exhibition period: 11 September 2019 ‚Äì 26 January 2020.

Visit PROPVIZ website https://propviz.com.au/white-rabbit-gallery-supernatural/

podcasts.title: Creative Technology at the Next Chapter
podcasts.description: A Video Wall engagement with Facial Recognition and Digby Webster Art

podcasts.title: See What I See - Vivid 2019
podcasts.description:
Many people with disabilities have amazing talents and heightened senses. Some express these attributes using their artistic abilities.  

Digby Webster is a widely exhibited, Sydney-based visual artist with disability. His canvases burst with vibrant colour whether they are abstracts, portraits or landscapes.

Digby‚Äôs perception of the world around him is fascinating. See What I See is an interactive installation that gives visitors a chance to experience the way Digby sees us. Stand in front of the frame and see yourself mirrored through advanced facial recognition technology that interprets your features and expressions into a morphing vision of colour and light that is uniquely Digby in style.

42 Interactive hope that the installation brings attention and exposure to artists with disabilities, and helps encourage inclusion of people of all abilities.

https://www.vividsydney.com/event/light/see-what-i-see-tumbalong-lights-inclusive-playspace

podcasts.title: 42 Interactive at PAX Melbourne 2018
podcasts.description:
After a year-long wait, I finally got the chance to go to the PAX AUS in Melbourne, It was a very memorable experience.

What is PAX?

PAX is a gaming convention where local indie game developers can showcase their games to the public alongside big behemoth corporate games studios and their triple-A games. Adding to the mix are some pop culture pop-up shops and cosplayers, creating an event where everyone can celebrate gaming.
